description:
I made the light, the water, and the earth below. Now it's time to make the life that dwells upon it. Actually... that sounds like a giant headache, so I'll contract it out! Heaven's Design Team is an agency that creates made-to-order life forms for their client, God. Why does this life form look like that? Why does this life form live this way? Watch the trials and successes of the designers and engineers forced to breathe life into God's absurd requests!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: แผนกออกแบบสร้างสรรค์โลก

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tarako73p) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=67890)

Born and raised in Tokyo. Started doujin activity in 2009 and debuted with "Mousou no Aki" in late 2012.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzukitsuta)

Currently lives in Kyoto.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nyorozo)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/増井壮一)

**Hayato Matsuo** is a Japanese arranger, composer, orchestrator and musician. Hayato is a composer, arranger and orchestrator for both the video game industry and the anime industry. He has worked on titles such as Front Mission 3, Final Fantasy XII, the Shenmue Series, and Magic Knight Rayearth. Inspired by his mother, who was a piano teacher, he graduated from the music composition department of Tokyo University of the Arts. While in college, he composed for the band G-Clef, and occasionally stood in for the members of the band. Upon graduating, he went to work under Sugiyama Kouichi, the composer of the popular Dragon Quest video game series, arranging his pieces for Dragon Quest anime shows and soundtracks. In 1991, Hayato began to work as a video game music composer himself, writing the score to Master of Monsters. Over the next few years, he worked as an independent composer on several games and anime series, including Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen. In 1995, he joined the independent music composition group Imagine. He has continued since then to compose and orchestrate works for over 20 games and anime shows, as well as the television show Kamen Rider 555, and a few pieces a part of original albums.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/megatofu)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/megatofu)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/151217/)._
__Momoko Naka__ is a Japanese photographer and director of photography affiliated with the Asahi Production Miyagi Shiroishi Studio.

[Website](https://96neko.jp/) | [Twitter (Main)](https://twitter.com/96__neko) | [Twitter (Sub)](https://twitter.com/96_neko_sub) | [YouTube 1](https://www.youtube.com/user/96nekoch) | [YouTube 2](https://www.youtube.com/c/SUB-96NEKOCHANNEL) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/9217369/mylist/15614906) | [Bilibili](https://space.bilibili.com/392617988) | [OPENREC](https://www.openrec.tv/user/96nyan)

__Introduction:__
96Neko, pronounced as Kuroneko, is an utaite and has been active in the vocaloid scene since 2009. She has covered over 200 songs in addition to performing, writing, composing and producing a large amount of original songs of her own.

She is well-known for her husky, low range vocals and for being a "ryouseirui", a term used to describe vocalists who are able to sing in both typical male and female vocal ranges. However, she is also able to sing in a very cute female voice, which can be heard in her cover of [Soratobazu](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm19159618).

96Neko is also a Virtual YouTuber and posts her activities on her sub-channel. On October 5, 2019, she had announced her new VTuber persona by the name of Kuroki Natsume. As of July 9, 2021, she settled to merge the personas, expressing that she finds it limiting (and other factors) and decided to perform all her activities under her utaite name. However, she stated that people may still call her VTuber persona by whatever name they want, whether it be Kuroki Natsume or Kuroneko, and asked them to not worry.

__Biography:__
During her early utaite career on Nico Nico Douga, she would often do duets with the vocaloids [Kagamine Rin](https://anilist.co/staff/191794/Rin-Kagamine) and [Kagamine Len](https://anilist.co/staff/154290/Len-Kagamine). She also sung many parody songs, where she mostly dueted with Kagamine Len or [vipTenchou](https://twitter.com/viptentyo). In later years, she would start collaborating with the utaite [Amatsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/131102/Amatsuki) in duets.

96Neko requested that people shouldn't record her anonymously with the intention of redistributing the footage commercially. She is fine with people recording for personal entertainment usage, however.

Her album, Iris, which was released just three days before her twentieth birthday, was her way of thanking her fans and supporters prior to her turning twenty. It also served as a final installment to her teenage years as an utaite.

__Agency:__ Atomic Monkey

[Profile](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/archives/talent/enokijunya) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/enojunjunjun) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A6%8E%E6%9C%A8%E6%B7%B3%E5%BC%A5)

Junya Enoki is a Japanese voice actor affiliated with Atomic Monkey. His hobbies are boxing and kendo. Enoki became interested in acting while in college after watching the anime Gurren Lagann. He's a cousin of [Chika Anzai](https://anilist.co/staff/106030).

__Non-Anime Roles:__ ~!
Caelus in "Honkai: Star Rail" (VG)!~
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yumi_hara.0121/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inouekazuhiko) | [Profile](http://www.b-box-box.com/actor/井上和彦/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/kazufan/) | [Anison](anison.info/data/person/1055.html) | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazuhiko_Inoue) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%95%E4%B8%8A%E5%92%8C%E5%BD%A6_(%E5%A3%B0%E5%84%AA))

Kazuhiko Inoue is a Japanese actor, voice actor and narrator, who has become one of Japan's most well established voice actors since his debut in 1973.

Inoue is widely known for roles such as [Kakashi Hatake](https://anilist.co/character/85/) in [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/), [Madara](https://anilist.co/character/13784/) in [Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/) and [Kars](https://anilist.co/character/21966/) in [JoJo's Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/14719/).

Inoue's early roles from the 1970s include [Anthony](https://anilist.co/character/9069/) in [Candy Candy](https://anilist.co/anime/2800/), and later as Joe in the 1979 remake of [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/). In the 1980s, Inoue's work ranged from the adult-oriented [Oishinbo](https://anilist.co/anime/1093/) to the popular [Tenkuu Senki Shurato](https://anilist.co/anime/2113/) for the younger generation.

Inoue does voices for anime, video games, drama CDs, Japanese-dubbed movies, and audio books. He has put out many LP and CD albums and has sung in various anime character albums. His most well-known songs are the ones related to the [Haruka: Beyond the Stream of Time](https://anilist.co/anime/247/) series, which he has performed live on stage at voice acting events in Japan. In recent years, Inoue has also tried his hand in backstage work such as sound directing. He has set up his own voice acting agency and school, B-Box, to teach the next generation voice talents.

He was also a close friend of the late fellow voice actor [Daisuke Gouri](https://anilist.co/staff/95744/).

__Awards__
- 2009, Best Actor in Supporting Role in the 3rd Seiyuu Awards as Madara in Natsume's Book of Friends.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Neuras - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)

__Height:__ 173 cm
__Hobbies:__ classic music appreciation, piano, guitar, singing

[Profile](https://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/294/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/UmeuMeumE_Y) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yūichirō_Umehara) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/梅原裕一郎)

A voice actor affiliated with [Arts Vision](https://anilist.co/studio/6367).

He revealed on April 4th, 2024 that he has been married to his college classmate since 2016.

**Non-Anime Roles:**

- Leona Kingscholar - Disney Twisted-Wonderland (VG)

__Height:__ 173 cm 

[Profile](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=11470) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MY_MURMUR) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/j.suwabe/)

Won Best Song at the 6th Seiyuu Awards (2012) for "ST☆RISH" (shared with Takuma Terashima, Kenichi Suzumura, Kishou Taniyama, Mamoru Miyano, Hiro Shimono) in _Uta no☆Prince-sama♪ Maji Love 1000%_. Won Best Supporting Actor at the 7th Seiyuu Awards (2013).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Radio DJ - Kamen Rider Kuuga (TV Series)
- Artem Wing - Tears of Themis (VG)
- Jenua - Epic Seven (VG)
- Dekotorade - Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger (TV Series)
- McBurn - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daisacusacu) | [Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/kishio-daisuke.html)

**Non anime roles**
- Brant - Wuthering Waves (VG)

__Height:__ 153 cm

[Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/ohzora-naomi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/osorasan703) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/osorasan703/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naomi_Ōzora) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大空直美)

Naomi Oozora is a Japanese voice actress from Osaka Prefecture.

In June 2012, she made her voice actor debut as a child in [Saint Seiya Omega](https://anilist.co/anime/12929). In January 2014, Oozora first starring role as [Inari Fushimi](https://anilist.co/character/74317) in [Inari, Konkon, Koi Iroha](https://anilist.co/anime/20488).

On May 25, 2023, she announced on Twitter that she had married that February to a man she met and dated from last year, and that she is pregnant.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/takeuchi-ryota.html) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/higeniku/) | [Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/takeuti_ryota) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/waruta_higeuti) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/takeuchi.ryota.3)

**Non-anime roles:**
• Skuld - Memento Mori (VG)
